channel.title: math.AC updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.AC updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Toric ideal of matching polytopes and edge colorings
item.description: arXiv:2501.19209v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In the present paper, we investigate the maximal degree of minimal generators of the toric ideal of the matching polytope of a graph. It is known that the toric ideal associated to a bipartite graph is generated by binomials of degree at most $3$. We show that this fact is equivalent to a result in the theory of edge colorings of bipartite multigraphs. Moreover, a characterization of bipartite graphs whose toric ideals are generated by quadratic binomials is given. Finally, we discuss the maximal degree of minimal generators of the toric ideal associated to a general graph and give a conjecture.
item.dc:creator: Kenta Mori, Ryo Motomura, Hidefumi Ohsugi, Akiyoshi Tsuchiya

item.title: A Basis Theorem for Rings with Commuting Operators in Characteristic Zero
item.description: arXiv:2501.19379v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Motivated by the differential basis theorem of Kolchin and the difference-differential basis theorem of Cohn, in this paper we present a basis theorem for polynomial rings equipped with commuting generalised Hasse-Schmidt operators (in the sense of Moosa and Scanlon). We recover Kolchin and Cohn's results as special cases of our main theorem.
item.dc:creator: Cas Burton

item.title: Order-Preserving outer automorphisms of free and surface groups
item.description: arXiv:2501.18847v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We give a complete classification to when a finite group of outer automorphisms preserves a bi-order on a non-abelian free group and bi-orderable surface groups. We also give another new criterion for an outer automorphism of $F_n$ induced by action of an $n$-strand braid to preserve a bi-order on $F_n.$ Using the new criterion, we produce examples of order-preserving whose underlying permutation is a full cycle which answers in affirmative a question of Kin and Rolfsen.
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Johnson, Khanh Le

item.title: Matrix factorization and the generic plane projection of curve a singularity
item.description: arXiv:2501.18926v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We study the matrix factorizations defined by the generic plane projections of a curve singularity of $\mathbb{C}^3$. On the other hand, given a plane curve singularity $Y\subset \mathbb{C}^2$ we study the family of matrix factorizations defined by the space curve singularities $X\subset \mathbb{C}^3$ such that $Y$ is the generic plane projection of $X$.
item.dc:creator: Joan Elias
